We have received advice from our London Agents, Messrs, dray, Dawes o. Co. that our Head office are arranging to despatch to us 100 gallons anti-fouling and 100 gallons anti-corrosive paint for use of our barges here and^we shall be glad if you will kindly telegraph the usual recomen- dation for export and shipping space. The usual statement of details in duplicate together with the original letter received from Messrs*, dray, Dawes <1 Co. (i.c/231) are enclosed herewith. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 36/70 Imports of Paints from U.S.A. & U.K.'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 61; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-52; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: This file contains applications for import/export licenses and shipping space that were sent to the Political Agency in Bahrain by a number of merchants active in the country. The applications relate to the importation of paints and inks from various suppliers in the United Kingdom and the United States.The file also contains related correspondence between officials at the Political Agency and the Government of Bahrain Customs Department.
